T1003.001::[Earth Lusca] has used ProcDump to obtain the hashes of credentials by dumping the memory of the LSASS process.
T1003.006::[Earth Lusca] has used a DCSync command with [Mimikatz] to retrieve credentials from an exploited controller.
T1027.003::[Earth Lusca] has used steganography to hide shellcode in a BMP image file.

T1036.005::[Earth Lusca] used the command `move [file path] c:\windows\system32\spool\prtprocs\x64\spool.dll` to move and register a malicious DLL name as a Windows print processor, which eventually was loaded by the Print Spooler service.
T1059.001::[Earth Lusca] has used PowerShell to execute commands.
T1059.006::[Earth Lusca] used Python scripts for port scanning or building reverse shells.
T1059.007::[Earth Lusca] has manipulated legitimate websites to inject malicious JavaScript code as part of their watering hole operations.
T1098.004::[Earth Lusca] has dropped an SSH-authorized key in the `/root/.ssh` folder in order to access a compromised server with SSH.
T1204.001::[Earth Lusca]  has sent spearphishing emails that required the user to click on a malicious link and subsequently open a decoy document with a malicious loader.
T1204.002::[Earth Lusca] required users to click on a malicious file for the loader to activate.
T1218.005::[Earth Lusca] has used `mshta.exe` to load an HTA script within a malicious .LNK file.

T1543.003::[Earth Lusca] created a service using the command sc create “SysUpdate” binpath= “cmd /c start “[file path]””&&sc config “SysUpdate” start= auto&&net
start SysUpdate for persistence.

T1547.012::[Earth Lusca] has added the Registry key `HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Control\Print\Environments\Windows x64\Print Processors\UDPrint” /v Driver /d “spool.dll /f` to load malware as a Print Processor.
T1548.002::[Earth Lusca] has used the Fodhelper UAC bypass technique to gain elevated privileges.
T1560.001::[Earth Lusca] has used WinRAR to compress stolen files into an archive prior to exfiltration.
T1566.002::[Earth Lusca] has sent spearphishing emails to potential targets that contained a malicious link.
T1567.002::[Earth Lusca] has used the megacmd tool to upload stolen files from a victim network to MEGA.
T1574.002::[Earth Lusca] has placed a malicious payload in `%WINDIR%\SYSTEM32\oci.dll` so it would be sideloaded by the MSDTC service.
T1583.001::[Earth Lusca] has registered domains, intended to look like legitimate target domains, that have been used in watering hole attacks.
T1583.004::[Earth Lusca] has acquired multiple servers for some of their operations, using each server for a different role.
T1583.006::[Earth Lusca] has established GitHub accounts to host their malware.
T1584.004::[Earth Lusca] has used compromised web servers as part of their operational infrastructure.
T1584.006::[Earth Lusca] has compromised Google Drive repositories.
T1588.001::[Earth Lusca] has acquired and used a variety of malware, including [Cobalt Strike].
T1588.002::[Earth Lusca] has acquired and used a variety of open source tools.
T1595.002::[Earth Lusca] has scanned for vulnerabilities in the public-facing servers of their targets.
T1608.001::[Earth Lusca] has staged malware and malicious files on compromised web servers, GitHub, and Google Drive.
